title: Losing way to much lp  and  not gaining enough
body: How is it possible  that i can get 12 to 13 lp when i win but when i lose  it cost me 21 lp . i'm in bronze 4 but when i was in 5 i was gaining 17 16 to 22  lp and losing 18 15 to 21 lp ,but now im in b4 and gaining  13 to 12  and losing 21 lp and its not because im losing a lot  .this was my 1st lost  in b4 and i saw how much it will cost me . it does not sim fear to  win 2 game and have  it all wiped out by just 1 lost .i do not think it is my MMR would not be the same in b5  if so. please  let me know why this is happen so i can better understand  what  is going on ,is their a bug in the system fix your  game riot

replies.body:
I'm not 100% certain I'm correct on this, however if I remember correctly I've read this somewhere.

When you win or lose, the game uses your MMR and compares it to the average MMR of players in the same ranking. If your MMR is below the average, you gain less LP and lose more LP, and if it's higher than the average, you gain more LP and lose less LP. This is to help players in rankings below their skill level to rank faster and slows boosting. Also, though I'm not sure, I'd imagine the b4 MMR average is quite a bit higher than the b5, since b5 is as low as you can go.
This might have something to do with it. Essentially, the system is trying to place you with others of similar MMR (where it thinks you should be with your current skill level).
